headline: Stock-Split Watch: Is Palantir Technologies Next?
summary: Palantir stock has climbed significantly since going public in 2020 -- enough that management could be considering a stock split to make its shares more accessible to a wider pool of investors.  If a stock split occurs, it won't change Palantir's fundamentals or prospects.  There's a bigger concern for investors who are looking to buy the stock right now.

raw.headline: Stock-Split Watch: Is Palantir Technologies Next?

headline: Palantir, Meta, OpenAI, And Thinking Machines Just Had Their Executives Sworn Into The US Army Reserve
summary: Four top tech executives have joined the U.S. Army Reserve as lieutenant colonels, skipping basic training and stepping directly into roles aimed at helping modernize the military. The initiative is part of a broader push by the Army to bring in private-sector innovation and reshape how the service approaches technology, talent, and modernization. Army Forms Detachment 201 To Bridge Tech And Defense The executives—Palantir (NYSE:PLTR) Chief Technology Officer Shyam Sankar, Meta (NASDAQ:META) CTO

headline: Is Palantir Technologies a Once-in-a-Generation AI Stock?
summary: Palantir has built a strong business with government and commercial ties.  Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) has been one of the hottest AI stocks over the past year and a half.  If it does, Palantir could be marked as a once-in-a-generation AI stock.

headline: What Are the Top 5 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy Right Now?
summary: Nvidia and Broadcom are two of the best plays on the artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure build-out.  TSMC has been a vital part of the semiconductor value chain and is set to benefit from increasing AI chip production.  Palantir Technologies and GitLab are two strong AI software plays.
